Input.Text-field: This assignment reinforces material discussed about quadratic residues, modular square roots, public key encryption and the Blum protocol. There are 5 problems each worth 20 points. Fill in the appropriate Maple code and text as reuested and submit your completed assignment through BBLearn. Assignments must be done individually.
Make sure you enter your name above.

Title.Text-field: Question 1 [20 points] (Square Roots mod p - the Easy Case)

Section.Text-field: Recall that the Legendre symbol can be computed quickly using an algorithm to compute the Jacobi symbol which is based on quadratic reciprocity. However, this only answers whether a number mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn has a square root but does not give a means of computing the square root; however, there are fast algorithms for computing square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn when they exist. It is particularly easy to do this when  Prove that if  mod 4 and LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEiYUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn is a quadratic residue mod  then  is a square root of  Using this formula, implement a Maple function ModSqrtEasy(a,p) which first checks to see, using the Legendre symbol if LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEiYUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn has a sqare root mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn and then if it does compute a square root using with this formula. Note that if there is one square root,  then  is another square root and these are the only square roots (why?). Make sure you thoroughly test your function. You may compare against the results returned by Maple's function msolve.

Title.Text-field: Question 2 [20 points] (Square Roots mod p - the Hard Case)

Section.Text-field: When  are more complicated ways of computing square roots mod 

In this question you will implement the Tonelli\342\200\223Shanks algorithm (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonelli%E2%80%93Shanks_algorithm). In addition to your implementation, provide, in your own words a brief description of how and why the algorithm works. Make sure you thoroughly test your function. You may compare against the results returned by Maple's function msolve.

Title.Text-field: Question 3 [20 points] (Modular Square Roots and the CRT)

Section.Text-field: Computing square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEibkYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn where LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEibkYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn is composite is easy provided you know the factorization of  When discussing the Blum algorithm we showed that computing square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEibkYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn where  is equivalent to factoring  In this question you are to use the Chinese Remainder theorem to compute square roots mod  First write a function modpsqrt(p,a), which computes squareroots of LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEiYUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn if they exist. Your function modsqrt(p,q,a) should use your functions from questions 1 and 2 to compute the square root of LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYjLUkjbWlHRiQ2I1EhRic=LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEiYUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn mod   provided they exist. Note a square root mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEibkYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn exists if and only if its exists mod  (why?). If square roots exist mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn and mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn then your routine should return all 4 square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEibkYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn. Use Maple's chrem function to compute the square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEibkYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn from the square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn and mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn using the Chinese Remainder theorem. Note if you did not complete questions 2 and 3, you may use Maple's msolve function to compute square roots mod LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEicEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn and mod 

Read section 3.10 of the HPS text. Implement Maple functions to Generate public and private keys for the Goldwasser-Micali cryptosystem. You may use the provided function RandPrime to generate random primes with LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEiZEYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn digits. Also write Maple functions Encrypt(publicKey,m) and Decrypt(privateKey,m) and demonstrate their use.

Input.Text-field: privateKey := GeneratePrivateKey(len); publicKey := GeneratePublicKey(privateKey[1],privateKey[2],privateKey[3]); encrypt := Encrypt(publicKey, plaintext, r); print("Plaintext is ", plaintext); Decrypt(privateKey, encrypt);

Given the public key  decrypt the encrypted bits 

Section.Text-field: Read section 8.3 of the HPS text and implement a simulation of the protocol discussed for proving that a given number LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEieUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn is a square mod  where  a product of two primes. Carry out your simulation when in fact LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEieUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn is a quadratic residue. Try the simulation again when LUklbXJvd0c2Iy9JK21vZHVsZW5hbWVHNiJJLFR5cGVzZXR0aW5nR0koX3N5c2xpYkdGJzYlLUkjbWlHRiQ2JlEieUYnLyUnaXRhbGljR1EldHJ1ZUYnLyUrZXhlY3V0YWJsZUdRJmZhbHNlRicvJSxtYXRodmFyaWFudEdRJ2l0YWxpY0YnRjIvRjZRJ25vcm1hbEYn is a non-residue. Will Victor accept the proof in this case?

Input.Text-field: simulation(x, y, N, r, s, B);
simulation(x, y, N, r, s, B);
